page.title: 11Customs 1--Denny & Dunipace
page.content: Before midnight on{Hogmanay,}December 31st, many Denny and Dunipace people gather at Denny Cross in the middle of the town. At 12 o'clock the church bell rings and pipebands start to play. The people cheer, shake hands and wish each other "A Happy New Year." Many exchange drinks. Then they disperse, some go home and others go first-foot friends.{First-footing}is an old Scottish custom. The first person to enter a house on New Year's Day must be a dark-haired man. Long ago the blonde Vikings used to come to Scotland to steal and destroy so the Scots thought that fair-haired men brought{bad luck.}The first-foot must carry shortbread or cake, whisky and a piece of coal or peat to bring good fortune to the household.
